pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.4: The section on how many offenses
pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.5: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.1: (1) For having sexual intercourse, how many kinds of offences does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.3: if one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.4: if one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.5: if one inserts the penis without touching into a wide open mouth, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.1: (2) For stealing, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.3: if, intending to steal, one steals something worth five _māsaka_ coins or more than five _māsakas_, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.4: if, intending to steal, one steals something worth more than one _māsaka_ coin but less than five _māsakas_, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.5: if, intending to steal, one steals something worth one _māsaka_ coin or less than one _māsaka_, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.1: (3) For intentionally killing a human being, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.3: if one digs a pit for people, thinking, “Falling into it someone will die,” one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.4: if the person experiences pain after falling, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.5: if the person dies, one commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.1: (4) For untruthfully and groundlessly boasting about a superhuman quality, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.3: if, having bad desires, overcome by desire, one claims a non-existent, unreal superhuman quality, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.4: if one says, “Whatever monk lives in your dwelling is a perfected one,” and the listener understands, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.5: if the listener does not understand, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:5.1: The four offenses entailing expulsion are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.0: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.1: (1) (…) For emitting semen by means of effort, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.2: if one intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.3: if one intends and makes an effort, but semen is not emitted, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.4: if one makes an effort, one commits a offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.1: (2) For making physical contact with a woman, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.2: if one touches body with body, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.3: if one touches what is connected to the body with the body, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.4: if one touches what is connected to the body with what is connected to the body, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.1: (3) For speaking indecent words to a woman, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.2: if, referring to the anus or the vagina, one praises and disparages, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.3: if, referring to any part below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, one praises and disparages, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.4: if, referring to anything connected to the body, one praises and disparages, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.1: (4) For commending the satisfaction of one’s own desires, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.2: if one encourages a woman to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.3: if one encourages a eunuch to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.4: if one encourages an animal to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.1: (5) For acting as a matchmaker, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.2: if one accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.3: if one accepts the mission, and finds out the response, but does not report back, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.4: if one accepts the mission, but neither finds out the response, nor reports back, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.1: (6) For having a hut built by means of begging, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.2: if one is having it built, then the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.3: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.4: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.1: (7) For having a large dwelling built, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.2: if one is having it built, then the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.3: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.4: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.1: (8) For groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.2: if, without having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.3: if, having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.1: (9) For charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.2: if, without having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.3: if, having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.1: (10) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is pursuing schism in the Sangha commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.1: (11) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, monks who side with a monk who is pursuing schism commit three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.2: after the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.3: after each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.4: when the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.1: (12) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is difficult to correct commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.1: (13) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is a corrupter of families commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:19.1: The thirteen rules entailing suspension are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.1: Telling a conscious lie how many offences does he fall into?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.2: Telling a conscious lie he falls into five offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.3: if, having evil desires, evil longings, he lays claim to a non-existent, non-actual state of further-men he falls into an offence involving Defeat;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.4: if he defames a monk with an unfounded charge of an offence involving Defeat there is an offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.5: if he says, “The monk who lives in this _vihāra_ is an arahant,” he falls into a grave offence for acknowledging (the conscious lie),
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.6: into an offence of wrong-doing for not acknowledging it;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.7: there is an offence of Expiation in conscious lying
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.8: Telling a conscious lie he falls into these five offences. [1]
pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.1: Insulting he falls into two offences:
